changelog.message: new version: active toggle, start loading file only when set to active
changelog.author: pandur

summary: Holds an audio file / sample in a buffer

ports.name: URL
ports.text: The audio file to load. Mostly you will drag an audio file into the cables window and select it via the file-chooser in the op parameter view. Depending on the browser you use (or user who will see / hear your exported patch) only certain file types can be played back. MP3 seems to be the best supported audio format. It is also possible to pass a data URL (from a local file) to the buffer.

ports.name: Audio Buffer
ports.text: The loaded audio buffer, can be connected to e.g. AudioBufferPlayer

ports.name: Finished Loading
ports.text: True when the file is loaded

ports.name: Sample Rate
ports.text: Samples per second of the PCM data stored in the buffer.

ports.name: Length
ports.text: Length of the buffer, in sample-frames, of the PCM data stored in the buffer.

ports.name: Duration
ports.text: Duration, in seconds, of the PCM data stored in the buffer

ports.name: Number of Channels
ports.text: How many channels the audio file contains, 2 is stereo, 1 is mono

ports.name: isLoading
ports.text: indicates if buffer is currently loading
